options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

title: Are pandas the most misunderstood animal? - Lucy Cooke

multiple-choice.question: What was the reason behind the "grand panda drama" at the Chicago Zoo in the late 1930s?

options.label: A
options.text: The zookeepers were trying to find a mate for a female panda named Mei Mei.

options.label: B
options.text: The zookeepers incorrectly classified the pandas as raccoons.

options.label: C
options.text: The zookeepers were trying to breed a male panda named Mei Lan with a female panda named Mei Mei.

options.label: D
options.text: The zookeepers were trying to determine the sex of the pandas.

multiple-choice.question: What was the challenge that zookeepers faced when trying to determine the sex of pandas?

options.label: A
options.text: The pandas' external genitals were visible from birth.

options.label: B
options.text: The pandas' external genitals didn't appear until they were a few months old and looked very similar.

options.label: C
options.text: The pandas' external genitals were only visible to humans.

options.label: D
options.text: The pandas' external genitals were not visible at all.

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the challenges that zookeepers face when trying to breed pandas in captivity?

options.label: B
options.text: Female pandas can only be impregnated 1 to 3 days each year due to their incredibly short ovulation window.

options.label: C
options.text: Female pandas are too picky about their mates.

options.label: D
options.text: Female pandas are not interested in mating.

multiple-choice.question: What is the reason why female pandas can only be impregnated 1 to 3 days each year?

options.label: A
options.text: Their ovaries are not developed enough.

options.label: B
options.text: Their ovulation window is too short.

options.label: C
options.text: Their hormones are not in sync.

options.label: D
options.text: Their bodies are not ready for pregnancy.

multiple-choice.question: What is the ability of female pandas to reabsorb their own fetuses called?

options.label: A
options.text: By rubbing their anal glands on tree trunks.

options.label: C
options.text: By competing with other males to see who can pee the highest.

options.label: A
options.text: The pandas' natural behavior is not suitable for breeding in captivity.

options.label: C
options.text: The pandas are not interested in mating.

options.label: D
options.text: The pandas' short ovulation cycles and ability to reabsorb fetuses.

multiple-choice.question: What is the most reliable approach that breeders have found to increase the captive population of pandas?

options.label: B
options.text: Showing pandas footage of mating elders.

options.label: D
options.text: Trying to kick start young pandas' sexual awakenings.

title: The science of laughter - Sasha Winkler

multiple-choice.question: What happens to your abdominal muscles when you laugh?

options.label: B
options.text: They contract rapidly and exert more force than usual.

options.label: C
options.text: They become weak and lose muscle control.

multiple-choice.question: Why do scientists think humans may have originally developed laughter?

options.label: A
options.text: To communicate complex ideas and emotions.

options.label: B
options.text: To clearly signal friendly, non-aggressive intent during social play.

options.label: C
options.text: To mimic the sounds of other animals.

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the reasons that laughter is contagious?

options.label: B
options.text: Because it's a universal human behavior.

options.label: C
options.text: Because it's an invitation to share in someone's emotional state.

options.label: D
options.text: Because it's a way to show dominance.

options.label: C
options.text: We trigger key regions in our brain, triggering us to smile or laugh ourselves.

options.label: D
options.text: We become more anxious and stressed.

options.text: Because it's a way to show dominance.

options.label: B
options.text: Because it's a universal human behavior.

options.label: C
options.text: Because it functions not only as a signal between individuals, but a broadcast to everyone around.

options.text: Whether they are joking or serious.

options.text: Because it's a way to show dominance.

options.label: C
options.text: Because it relies on speech-like pathways.

multiple-choice.question: What was the trend observed by American whaling ships in the North Pacific in the mid-1800s?

options.label: C
options.text: A type of predator that the sperm whale avoids

options.label: C
